meanings.definition: A person who has the legal right or exclusive title to something.
meanings.sent1: The propretors of the house were thrilled to finally receive the deed.
meanings.sent2: The propretors of the land decided to build a new fence around their property.
meanings.sent3: The propretors of the treasure chest were surprised to find it filled with old toys.
meanings.sent4: She felt like the propretors of her own destiny, steering her life in the direction she wanted.
meanings.sent5: The propretors of the ancient artifact guarded it with great care.

meanings.definition: The owner of a business or property.
meanings.sent1: The propretors of the store were planning a big sale for the weekend.
meanings.sent2: As the propretors of the farm, they took pride in their bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent3: The propretors of the amusement park enjoyed watching visitors have fun on the rides.
meanings.sent4: She was the propretors of her own small bakery, creating delicious treats for the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The propretors of the historic building worked hard to preserve its original charm.
